qas.question: What two entities was the foundation divided into

answers.text: trustees divided the organization into two entities: the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (foundation) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust

qas.question: What does the foundation entity focus on

answers.text: The foundation section, based in Seattle, US, "focuses on improving health and alleviating extreme poverty

qas.question: What does the Trust entity focus on

answers.text: The trust section manages "the investment assets and transfer proceeds to the foundation as necessary to achieve the foundation's charitable goals

qas.question: What is held in the trust entity

answers.text: it holds the assets of Bill and Melinda Gates, who are the sole trustees, and receives contributions from Buffett

plausible_answers.text: the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (foundation) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust (trust).

qas.question: What two sections was the trust divided into?

plausible_answers.text: manages "the investment assets and transfer proceeds to the foundation as necessary to achieve the foundation's charitable goals

context: The foundation explains on its website that its <a0_0>trustees divided the organization into <b7_0>two entities<b7_0/>: <b4_0>the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (foundation) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust<a0_0/> (trust).<b4_0/> <a1_0><b8_0>The foundation section, based in Seattle, US, "focuses on improving health and alleviating extreme poverty<a1_0/>,<b8_0/>" and its trustees are Bill and Melinda Gates and Warren Buffett. <a2_0>The trust section <b5_0>manages "the investment assets and transfer proceeds to the foundation as necessary to achieve the foundation's charitable goals<b5_0/><a2_0/>"—<a3_0><b6_0>it holds the assets<b6_0/> of Bill and Melinda Gates, who are the sole trustees, and receives contributions from Buffett<a3_0/>.
